Sentencas: Yttria-stabilized zireonia (YSZ) is an important oxide ion conductor with applications in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) and oxygen sensing devices.
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study

Sentencas: Doping the cubic phase of zirconia (c-ZrO2) with yttria (Y2O3) is isoelectronic, as two Zr4+ ions are replaced by two Y3+ ions, plus a charge compensating oxygen vacancy (O-vac).
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study

Sentencas: Typical doping concentrations include 3, 8, 10, and 12 mol %.
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study

Sentencas: For these concentrations, and all below 40 mol %, no phase with long-range order has been observed in either X-ray or neutron diffraction experiments.
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study

Sentencas: The prediction local defect structure and the interaction between defects is therefore of great interest.
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study

Sentencas: This has not been possible to date as the number of possible defect topologies is very large and to perform reliable total energy calculations for all of them would be prohibitively expensive.
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study

Sentencas: Previous theoretical studies have only considered a selection of representative structures.
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study

Sentencas: In this study, a comprehensive search for low-energy defect structures using a combined classical modeling and density functional theory approach is used to identify the low-energy isolated defect structures at the dilute limit, 3.2 mol %.
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study

Sentencas: Through analysis of energetics computed using the best available Born-Mayer-Huggins empirical potential model, a point charge model, DFT, and a local strain energy estimated in the harmonic approximation, the main chemical and physical descriptors that correlate to the low-energy DFT structures are discussed.
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study

Sentencas: It is found that the empirical potential model reproduces a general trend of increasing DFT energetics across a series of locally strain relaxed structures but is unreliable both in predicting some incorrect low-energy structures and in finding some metastable structures to be unstable.
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study

Sentencas: A better predictor of low-energy defect structures is found to be the total electrostatic energy of a simple point charge model calculated at the unrelaxed geometries of the defects.
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study

Sentencas: In addition, the strain relaxation energy is estimated effectively in the harmonic approximation to the imaginary phonon modes of undoped c-ZrO2 but is found to be unimportant in determining the low-energy defect structures.
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study

Sentencas: These results allow us to propose a set Of easily computed descriptors that can be used to identify the low-energy YSZ defect structures, negating the combinatorial complexity and number of defect structures that need to be considered.
Titulo: Chemical Descriptors of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia at Low Defect Concentration: An ab Initio Study
